text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pad thai popcorn that's right
we're going to do an incredibly
addictive sweet and spicy popcorn
inspired by the famous thai noodle dish
and i wish I could take credit for this
great idea but actually saw this on
television a bar in south carolina
serves it you can read about that on the
blog post so we're going to start of
course by making some popcorn you got to
do your popcorn ahead of time okay so
i'm going to make a standard batch of
stovetop popcorn you know the drill i've
heard reports that for whatever reason
this doesn't work as well with microwave
popcorn so i think you want to pop your
popcorn fresh for this when the popcorn
is done I want you to transfer that into
a large bowl but to transfer it I'd like
you to use one of these strainers or of
course your fingers but what you're
doing is you're transferring it without
getting any of the unpopped kernels in
the mix okay you don't want anyone
breaking a tooth on your snack people
are very litigious these days so be
careful alright so last thing before we
move on to the sauce I want you to dump
in about a cup of finely chopped peanuts
okay the smaller the better the smaller
they are the better they're going to
stick to the corn and we're just going
to reserve that until our caramel sauce
is done and to get ready for that we're
going to go ahead and grate the zest off
some lime all right we're going to use
some of the juice also but I want all
that beautiful green zest none of the
white only the green that's where all
the flavor is now I did one lime and I
kind of wish I did too so great your
lime set that aside we're going to move
to the stove where I have a
heavy-bottomed saucepan into which I'm
going to add my brown sugar some
vegetable oil all right after the
vegetable oil we're going to add some
corn syrup by the way fun fact corn
syrup is not poisonous do I buy
processed foods with corn syrup in it no
but a couple times a year am i afraid to
eat it in something like this no why not
because I'm not crazy alright after that
I'm going to squeeze in the juice of
half a lime and then the most important
ingredient in my opinion to make this
Pad Thai ish Asian fish sauce there are
no substitutes get some you can find it
or you can order it online you must have
fish sauce in your kitchen alright so
I'm going to dump in the fish sauce I'm
going to put the heat on medium I'm
going to give that
stur so what I want you to do is bring
this to a boil over medium heat when it
comes to a boil start your timer and
boil it for five minutes
all right give it a stir once in a while
and five minutes later it's gonna look
something like that all right turn off
the heat and add the final ingredients
and then be ready to move quick so here
we go
Heat's off I'm gonna add my chili
peppers now you can use finely diced
fresh chilies I'm using sambal all right
you can see I wasn't shy there this
should be spicy so a big old spoon of
sambar I'm going to add my lime zest and
then a little touch of baking soda and
as soon as you add that baking soda a
million possibly billion tiny bubbles
will form that's going to lighten this
caramel sauce and allow it to completely
coat your popcorn now at this point you
have to move very quick dump it over
your popcorn and stir until coated you
do not want that caramel sauce cooling
down at all all right and that's such a
big deal I didn't even want to risk
stopping for a minute to reposition my
camera to get the money shot of the
caramel be important under the popcorn
because you know what you guys have very
vivid imaginations so I'm sure you can
imagine what that looked like so just
dump your caramel in and once it's
thoroughly coated I want you to dump
that onto a lined baking sheet I'm using
a silicone liner I'm sure you could use
some oiled foil instead we're going to
spread that out evenly and we're going
to pop that in a 250 degree oven of
course you're going to preheat it first
and we're going to pop that in the oven
for about 45 minutes every 10 or 15
minutes I want you to pull it out and
give it a toss with your spatula even it
out pop it back in 15 minutes pull it
out give it another toss and 45 minutes
later mine look like that and by the way
that's what yours is going to look like
so we're going to give it one last toss
you're thinking hmm this doesn't seem
crispy and awesome seems kind of I don't
know sticky and soggy relax as soon as
it cools off it's going to sound and
feel like this
oh yeah how's it not going to taste good
when it sounds like that and that is so
incredibly tasty it's amazing but we're
not done when you go to serve this I
want you to chop up a whole bunch of
fresh cilantro and sprinkle it over to
complete the Pad Thai experience and
does it actually taste like pad thai of
course not it's popcorn but those
flavors you love from pad thai the lime
the fish sauce the hot chili the
herbaceousness from the cilantro it's
all there and it's incredibly delicious
and addictive and also let me give you a
little heads up as you taste this for
the first time the first bite tastes
exactly like caramel corn you're like
what's the big deal this tastes like
caramel corn but then the second third
fourth fifth bite the heat starts to
build your palate opens up and you start
to get that lime and you start to get
that fish sauce and it's really really
amazing all right so head over to food
wishes comm for all the very specific
ingredient amounts this is one of those
recipes where you really do need
specific measurements so check it out
along with more info as usual and as
always enjoy
you
